dataObjects.title: Barcode data: Atyopsis moluccensis
dataObjects.description:
The following is a representative barcode sequence, the centroid of all available sequences for this species.


There is 1 barcode sequence available from BOLD and GenBank.

Below is the sequence of the barcode region Cytochrome oxidase subunit 1 (COI or COX1) from a member of the species.

See the BOLD taxonomy browser for more complete information about this specimen.

Other sequences that do not yet meet barcode criteria may also be available.

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: De Grave, S., Klotz, W. & Page, T. 2013. Atyopsis moluccensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2013

Assessor/s
De Grave, S., Klotz, W. & Page, T.

Reviewer/s
Cumberlidge, N. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
This species has a wide distribution, ranging from Sri Lanka through Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and possibly the Philippines (Chace 1983), occurring in fast flowing streams, usually in upland areas. Although localized subsistence fishing for this species is known to occur, no specific threats to the species could be identified. In view of its wide distribution and the absence of any known, major threats, the species is considered of Least Concern.
